title: Aurelio Scagnellato
text:
Aurelio Scagnellato (26 October 1930 – 10 July 2008) was an Italian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> and <a href="managing%20director">managing director</a>. He is known for his time with the successful <a href="Calcio%20Padova">Padova</a> side during the late 1950s and early 1960s.
Career.
Scagnellato spent his entire professional career with Padova, and was part of the cub's famous defensive line under manager <a href="Nereo%20Rocco">Rocco</a> – nicknamed "The Panzer of Rocco" – that contributed decisively to the best ever league placement in the history of the Venetian club, a third-place finish during the <a href="1957%E2%80%9358%20Serie%20A">1957–58 Serie A</a> season.
With 349 appearances, he is the player with the most matches played in the history of Padova.
After retiring from football, he took on a series of technical and managerial positions at the club, and also held the position of the team's Sporting Director.
